ETYMOLOGY: From Old French oignement, from Latin unguentum 'an ointment, unguent', from unguere 'to anoint'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A smooth, oily preparation rubbed on the skin for medicinal purposes or as a cosmetic.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种涂抹在皮肤上用于药用或化妆品的润滑油状制剂。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She applied a soothing ointment to the burn.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她把一种舒缓的药膏涂在烧伤处。
